Dear Ms. Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Despite already being investigated, a staff touches youth on the
face, mouth and rubs youth back in an uncomfortable manner.
Investigation On 12/4/24 Complainant reported around October or November
2024 there was an investigation regarding Staff 1 inappropriately
touching Youth A. The investigation was not substantiated and
was closed. Youth A does not feel safe around Staff 1. Staff 1 has
been touching Youth A’s mouth with his hand and rubbing Youth
A’s back in an uncomfortable manner. Complainant was contacted
by phone on 12/5/24. Complainant stated they did not have any
knowledge of this occurring but took the proper steps to report
what they were told.
Interviews:
Foster Care Worker was interviewed by phone on 12/5/24.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) stated she had no knowledge of Staff
1 touching Youth A. FCW stated Youth A was having a difficult
week due to a recent meeting where it was decided Youth A
would stay at the facility. Youth A made the allegation regarding
Staff 1 during the meeting. FCW explained in the meeting an
investigation (2024SIC0001759) was previously completed
regarding this allegation. After the meeting, Staff 1 asked Youth A
if there were any new incidents that needed to be investigated.
Staff 1 stated she could not get the truth out of Youth A, as she
would not answer any questions. Youth A would only state that
she felt unsafe and would do whatever she needed to get out of
the facility. FCW noted she previously discussed the prior
investigation with Youth A on 11/8/24. At that time, Youth A
indicated she felt safe and had no concerns about the facility.
FCW emailed DCWL on 12/6/24 after completing a visit with
Youth A at the facility. FCW reported she had some clarification
from Youth A regarding Staff 1. Youth A told Staff 1 that there was
not any new inappropriate touching by Staff 1. What she stated in
the meeting was from the allegation in the prior investigation.
2

Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/6/24.
Youth A reported Staff 1 continued to walk through her unit,
despite the prior investigation. Youth A was asked if this was still
occurring during the evening shift, as Staff 1 was a supervisor and
needed to check in with staff periodically as determined in the
previous investigation. Youth A said yes. But sometimes Staff 1
will sit down and talk with people. Youth A stated she needed to
be moved from the facility. Youth A stated she was very upset that
there were no findings in the previous investigation. The findings
were reviewed with Youth A again and she was asked if there was
any information that was missed or untrue. Youth A would not
answer. Youth A verbalized her anger about not being moved
after the first investigation. Youth A was visibly very angry. Youth
A was asked if there had been any situations with Staff 1 that
made her uncomfortable, since the prior investigation. Youth A
answered no. Youth A stated that she did not want to be there
because she had issues with a peer. Youth A did not have any
new information or allegations regarding Staff 1.
Chief Administrator was contacted via email on 12/9/24. Chief
Administrator reported Staff 1 was aware to maintain distance
from Youth A. This would be reiterated with the Unit Manager as
well, so as not to put Staff 1 in a position where additional
allegations could occur. Follow-up occurred via email on 1/26/25.
Chief Administrator confirmed the Unit Manager spoke with Staff 1
about maintaining distance and no further concerns have been
reported.
Documents reviewed:
• Safety Plan dated 12/5/24, authored by FCW and signed by
Youth A. Youth A identified a safe person at Vista Maria to
discuss concerns with. Youth A was provided with phone
numbers to report any concerns. Youth A would not be
alone with Staff 1. Youth A would be staffed 1:1 at all times.
Analysis No violation was found as the allegation was previously
investigated and there was no new information presented at this
time.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Staff-to-resident-ratio
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127
Section (3) The ratio formula for direct care workers shall correspond with
Description the institution's purpose and the needs of the residents and shall
3

assure the continual safety, protection, and direct care and
supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facility insisted on 1:1 supervision for the youth and has not
been providing it.
Investigation On 12/4/24 Complainant reported Youth A was approved for 1:1
supervision. Youth A was required to have a 1:1 supervisor from
7:00am-9:15pm. This supervision was requested by Vista Maria
staff and approved by MDHHS. Youth A does not consistently
have a 1:1 staff. There is concern this was deemed necessary by
Vista Maria for the safety of Youth A, but the facility is not
following through.
Interviews:
Foster Care Worker was interviewed by phone on 12/5/24. FCW
reported Youth A told her she did not have a 1:1 staff most days.
FCW stated this would not be the first time the facility has asked
for 1:1 staff, then stopped using it without notifying the worker.
FCW was unsure who would make that determination at the
facility. FCW clarified that 1:1 staffing was just approved on
11/15/24, after Youth A had two incidents of breaking windows
and injuring staff.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/5/24. It
was observed that Youth A had 1:1 staff at that time. When asked
about 1:1 staffing, Youth A stated she did not always have staff.
When asked if she recalled any recent dates that she did not have
staff, Youth A answered no. Youth A was asked if she had staff
every day during the current week, she refused to answer. When
asked if she had 1:1 staff every day last week, she refused to
answer. It was explained to Youth A that the more information she
could provide, the easier it would be for DCWL to determine any
issues and correct them. Youth A was very angry about the
investigation and refused to speak any further.
Rights Officer was contacted via email on 12/6/24 and asked to
provide the 1:1 schedule for Youth A from 11/15/24 to 12/6/24.
Documents reviewed:
• Youth A’s case record was reviewed regarding service
plans and requirement for supervision. Updated Service
Plan dated 11/25/24, stated that Youth A was placed on 1:1
4

staffing for behavior monitoring effective 11/12/24 and
remained on that until otherwise documented.
• Safety Plan dated 12/5/24, authored by FCW and signed by
Youth A. Youth A would be staffed 1:1 at all times.
• The 1:1 staffing schedule for Youth A was reviewed from
11/12/24- 12/7/24. Youth A was provided 1:1 staff every
day, except for the afternoons of 11/17/24, 11/18/24 and
11/23/24.
Analysis A violation was found as Youth A was not provided with
supervision as outlined in their treatment plan.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(b) The services provided to residents and parents directly by
the institution and the services provided by outside resources.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facility is denying the youth the ability to make phone calls to
her case manager/MDHHS.
Investigation On 12/4/24 Complainant reported the facility was denying Youth
A the ability to make calls to her caseworker or Centralized Intake.
Youth A asked to call her worker and was told that she did not
need to call her. Youth A was allowed to make calls at times but
specifically was denied opportunities to call her caseworker.
Interviews:
Foster Care Worker was interviewed by phone on 12/5/24. FCW
was aware that staff told Youth A she could not make calls if she
had already made calls and left messages for FCW. FCW felt that
was reasonable as Youth A would otherwise call her ten times or
so. FCW told Youth A that she only had to leave one message
and FCW would call her back when she got the message. FCW
asked Youth A if she were truly being denied phone calls, or was
she upset FCW did not call her back fast enough? Youth A would
not give an answer. Youth A also complained that youth only get
an hour to make phone calls. Youth A stated that some phones on
the unit were broken a well.
5

Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/6/24.
Youth A stated that she sometimes could not make calls as staff
were busy and told her to hold on but then did not let her make a
call until after 5:30pm. Youth A stated that some peers broke the
phones on the unit. Therefore, supervisors had to bring phones on
the unit to make calls. Youth were limited to 10-minute calls each,
so that everyone was able to complete calls from 7-8:00PM. Youth
A could not recall any staff that told her she could not call FCW.
When asked of a recent day that she was not allowed to call FCW,
Youth A stated she did not know. Youth A would not answer
further questions.
Documents reviewed:
• The facility program statement dated 3/22/24 was
reviewed. The program statement indicates youth are
provided phone call opportunities. However, it did not
indicate the frequency or duration.
• Client Telephone Calls policy revised October 2024. Policy
indicated youth can make calls upon request, Monday
through Friday after 3:00PM, as long as calls do not
interfere with the educational or therapeutic process within
the program.
• Phone call logs for Youth A were reviewed from 9/18/24-
11/22/24. The logs indicated Youth A made 34 phone calls
to family members, mentors, and FCW. These calls
occurred at various times from 3:00PM to 8:59PM.
Analysis No violation was found as interviews and documents indicated
Youth A was able to make phone calls in accordance with agency
policy.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
